repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

did.abstract: This series contains artwork, drawings, and notes created by School of Museum of Fine Arts student Lillian Seavey.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the School of the Museum of Fine Arts, 2019, accession MS-2020-007.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in one series.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Lillian Seavey was born on October 18, 1866 in Cambridge, Massachusetts to Theodore and Caroline Seavey. She entered the School of the Museum of Fine Arts in September 1885 and studied design there until roughly 1887. In 1907, she married Benjamin Sargent Osgood. She died in 1949 in Cambridge, Massachusetts.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: This collection was likely purchased at a yard sale by a School of Museum of Fine Arts faculty member and donated to the School of the Museum of Fine Art's archives. The School of the Museum of Fine Arts became a part of Tufts University's School of Arts and Sciences in 2016, and in 2019, the collection was transferred to Digital Collections and Archives at Tufts University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This series was processed by Records and Accessioning Archivist, Jane Kelly, in August 2021. Loose items were placed in archival folders. Original order was maintained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains artwork, drawings, and notes created by Lillian Seavey. The notes are from a course on decoration and the artwork is primarily of decorative and architectural designs and details. The collection also contains two pamphlets from the Technology Architectural Review.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Copyright to all materials created by Tufts University employees in the course of their work is held by the Trustees of Tufts University.
